skills.name: Install Drizzle
skills.pattern:
npm install drizzle-orm
npm install drizzle-kit --save-dev
npm install @neondatabase/serverless # or pg, mysql2, better-sqlite3

skills.name: Define Schema
MySQL Schema
SQLite Schema
PostgreSQL Connection
Neon Serverless
Select
skills.pattern:
const allUsers = await db.select().from(users);
const user = await db.select().from(users).where(eq(users.id, 1));

skills.name: Select Fields
skills.pattern: const names = await db.select({ name: users.name, email: users.email }).from(users);

skills.name: Insert
Insert Returning
skills.pattern: const [user] = await db.insert(users).values({ name: 'John' }).returning();

skills.name: Update
skills.pattern: await db.update(users).set({ name: 'Jane' }).where(eq(users.id, 1));

skills.name: Delete
skills.pattern: await db.delete(users).where(eq(users.id, 1));

skills.name: Where Conditions
skills.pattern: import { eq, ne, gt, gte, lt, lte, like, ilike, inArray, notInArray, isNull, isNotNull, and, or, not } from 'drizzle-orm';

skills.name: Complex Where
Order By
skills.pattern:
import { asc, desc } from 'drizzle-orm';
await db.select().from(users).orderBy(desc(users.createdAt));

skills.name: Limit & Offset
skills.pattern: await db.select().from(users).limit(10).offset(20);

skills.name: Define Relations
Inner Join
skills.pattern:
await db.select().from(users)
  .innerJoin(posts, eq(users.id, posts.authorId));

skills.name: Left Join
skills.pattern:
await db.select().from(users)
  .leftJoin(posts, eq(users.id, posts.authorId));

skills.name: Relational Queries
Aggregations
Group By
Transaction
Raw SQL
Generate Migrations
skills.pattern:
npx drizzle-kit generate:pg
npx drizzle-kit push:pg # direct push
npx drizzle-kit migrate

skills.name: Drizzle Config
Drizzle Studio
skills.pattern: npx drizzle-kit studio

skills.name: TypeScript Types
skills.pattern:
type User = typeof users.$inferSelect;
type NewUser = typeof users.$inferInsert;

skills.name: Prepared Statements
skills.pattern:
const prepared = db.select().from(users).where(eq(users.id, sql.placeholder('id'))).prepare();
const user = await prepared.execute({ id: 1 });

skills.name: Benefits
skills.pattern: TypeScript-first, SQL-like syntax, lightweight, no code generation required, serverless-ready
